page.title: 01BROCKHAMPTON,a general view.
page.content: The area is mostly farming land, situated between the {Vale of Evesham} and the {Cotswold Hills}around the tiny village of { {Brockhampton,Gloucestershire.} The Hyde Brook runs through the area from N.W to S.E. The area is also divided by the Gloucester to Birmingham railway and the busy A435. {Bishops Cleeve},a big village,{Swindon {Village},a small village and{Elmstone {Hardwicke},a hamlet with an ancient church are partly included in our area There are 17 farms,some arable,beef, dairy,pig farms and a riding school. They grow cereals but mainly grass for cattle feeding with hay/silage for winter.The farms vary in size,from 360 to 14 acres. {Smiths Industries},a large engineer- ing firm with many employees making computerised aircraft equipment.
